thread.title: Brazil shares higher at close of trade; Bovespa up 0.26% By Investing.com
thread.title_full: Brazil shares higher at close of trade; Bovespa up 0.26% By Investing.com

author: Investing.com
title: Brazil shares higher at close of trade; Bovespa up 0.26% By Investing.com
text:
Investing.com â€“ Brazil equities were higher at the close on Thursday, as gains in the Financials , Basic Materials and Electric Power sectors propelled shares higher.
At the close in Sao Paulo, the Bovespa gained 0.26%.
The biggest gainers of the session on the Bovespa were IRB Brasil Resseguros SA (BVMF: IRBR3 ), which rose 11.30% or 4.35 points to trade at 42.85 at the close. Brava Energia SA (BVMF: BRAV3 ) added 6.64% or 1.27 points to end at 20.40 and Companhia Brasileira De Distribuica (BVMF: PCAR3 ) was up 5.35% or 0.13 points to 2.56 in late trade.
Biggest losers included Cvc Brasil ON (BVMF: CVCB3 ), which lost 7.74% or 0.12 points to trade at 1.43 in late trade. Magazine Luiza SA (BVMF: MGLU3 ) declined 6.45% or 0.45 points to end at 6.53 and Minerva SA/Brazil (BVMF: BEEF3 ) shed 4.04% or 0.22 points to 5.22.
Advancing stocks outnumbered falling ones by 618 to 346 and 46 ended unchanged on the B3 Stock Exchange.
The CBOE Brazil Etf Volatility , which measures the implied volatility of Bovespa options, was down 1.33% to 34.12.
In commodities trading, Gold Futures for February delivery was up 0.71% or 18.61 to $2,654.11 a troy ounce. Meanwhile, Crude oil for delivery in February fell 0.70% or 0.49 to hit $69.61 a barrel, while the March US coffee C contract fell 1.84% or 6.05 to trade at $322.55 .
USD/BRL was down 0.12% to 6.18, while EUR/BRL fell 8.24% to 6.42.
The US Dollar Index Futures was down 0.13% at 107.88.
